info.title: Orders API
info.description:
>Check the new [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

Receive, process, and manage every order in your store through our Order Management API.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves order details by searching a specific order ID or sequence number.

> The `View order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc).

> üìò Onboarding guide 
>
> Check the new [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Order ID is a unique code that identifies an order. Instead of using `orderId`, you can also make the request using the sequence, a six-digit string that follows the order ID. For example, in order 1268540501456-01 (501456), the sequence is 501456. To use this parameter, replace the value between `{ }` keys in `seq{sequence-number}` with the sequence. For example: `seq501456`.

approvedBy.description: User that approved the order, in case of manual approval.

marketplaceOrderId.description: ID of the order in the marketplace.

marketplaceServicesEndpoint.description: Marketplace endpoint for post purchase communication.

affiliateId.description: Three letter code identifying the marketplace where the order was placed.

statusDescription.description: `Deprecated`. Status description which is displayed on the Admin panel.

totals.description: Information on each of the order's totals.

id.description: Order's total ID.

items.description: Information on each item in the order.

id.description: ID.

manualPriceAppliedBy.description: User that applied the manual price, if that is the case.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

isGift.description: Indicates whether item is a gift.

productCategories.description: Object, where each field is an ID from `productCategoryIds.

{ID}.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

id.description: Service identifier.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

items.description: Information on each item in the package.

itemIndex.description: Item index in reference to the position of the item in the `items` array.

courier.description: The name of the carrier responsible for delivering the order.

trackingNumber.description: The number code that identifies the order tracking. *This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).*

type.description: Invoice type `Output` for sales and `Input` for returns.

restitutions.description: Information on how restitutions are to be made to the customer, in case of a return (invoice `type` is `input`).

itemIndex.description: Item index corresponding to the position of the item in the main `items` array.

volumes.description: Quantity of packages involved in the order.

invoiceData.description: Information pertinent to the order's invoice.

allowCancellation.description: Indicates whether cancelation is allowed for the order.

allowEdition.description: Indicates whether edition is allowed for the order.

isCheckedIn.description: Indicates whether client is checked in.

authorizedDate.description: Date in which the order was authorized in UTC.

invoicedDate.description: Date in which the order was invoiced in UTC.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of orders according to the filters described below. 

The limit of information retrieval is 30 pages, the default number of orders per page is 15 and it is possible to configure it up to 100 using the  `per_page` parameter. 

 Be aware that as of October 3rd, 2018, this endpoint will not return the `items` property. 

> This should **not** be used for integrations. Use the [orders Feed or hook](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/orders-feed) for this purpose.

This endpoint returns only orders that already have been indexed, which takes approximately four minutes. Because of this, the data retrieved may present inconsistencies. To get live up-to-date information and [build order integrations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/erp-integration-set-up-order-integration) use the [orders Feed or hook](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/orders-feed).

> üìò Onboarding guide 
>
> Check the new [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
You can retrieve orders lists filtering by an `OrderField` combined with an `OrderType`. To do so, you have to concatenate them: `orderBy={{OrderField}},{{OrderType}}`. 
- `OrderField` values accepted: `creationDate`, `orderId`, `items`, `totalValue` and `origin`. 
- `OrderType` values accepted: `asc` and `desc`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Define the number of pages you wish to retrieve, restricted to the limit of 30 pages.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Quantity of orders for each page, the default value is 15 and it goes up to 100 orders per page. Be aware that the limit of retrieval ofthis endpoint is 30 pages.

parameters.name: f_creationDate
parameters.description: Concatened value sufix `{{creationDate}}` and range date in Timestamp format. To use the `utc` query parameter, to filter orders by time zone, you must also fill the `f_creationDate` date parameter.

parameters.name: f_hasInputInvoice
parameters.description: Filters list to return only orders with non `null` values for the `invoiceInput` field.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
This parameter filters using Fulltext and accepts the values below. Be aware that the `+` caracter is not allowed in Fulltext Search. 
- Order Id 
- Client email 
- Client document 
- Client name

schema.default:
- OrderID: v212333lux-02 
- Client email: taylor@email.com 
- Client document: 21133355524 
- Client name: Taylor

parameters.name: utc
parameters.description: Converts orders' time zone to the Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) format and shows the amount of orders set for that UTC, up to the limit of 30 pages. For it to work properly, you have to associate it with the `f_creationDate` parameter.

parameters.name: f_shippingEstimate
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by shipping estimate time in days by concatenating the desired number of days with the sufix `.days`. For example: 
- Next 7 days: `7.days` 
- Tomorrow: `1.days` 
- Today: `0.days` 
- Late: `-1.days`

parameters.name: f_invoicedDate
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by invoiced date by concatenating the sufix `invoicedDate:` with the range date in Timestamp format. For example: 
- 1 Day: `invoicedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-02T01:59:59.999Z]`
- 1 Month: `invoicedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-02-01T01:59:59.999Z]` 
- 1 Year: `invoicedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-01T01:59:59.999Z]`

parameters.name: f_creationDate
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by creation date by concatenating the sufix `creationDate:` with the range date in Timestamp format. For example: 
- 1 Day: `creationDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-02T01:59:59.999Z]`
- 1 Month: `creationDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-02-01T01:59:59.999Z]` 
- 1 Year: `creationDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-01T01:59:59.999Z]`

parameters.name: f_authorizedDate
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by creation date by concatenating the sufix `authorizedDate:` with the range date in Timestamp format. For example: 
- 1 Day: `authorizedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-02T01:59:59.999Z]`
- 1 Month: `authorizedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-02-01T01:59:59.999Z]` 
- 1 Year: `authorizedDate:[2022-01-01T02:00:00.000Z TO 2022-01-01T01:59:59.999Z]`

parameters.name: f_UtmSource
parameters.description: You can filter orders by using a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) source.

parameters.name: f_sellerNames
parameters.description: You can filter orders by using a seller's name.

parameters.name: f_callCenterOperatorName
parameters.description: You can filter orders by using a Call Center Operator's identification.

parameters.name: f_salesChannel
parameters.description: You can filter orders by sales channel's ([or trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) name.

parameters.name: salesChannelId
parameters.description: You can filter orders by sales channel's ([or trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) ID.

parameters.name: f_affiliateId
parameters.description: You can filter orders by affiliate ID.

parameters.name: f_status
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by the following [order status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196): 
- `waiting-for-sellers-confirmation` 
- `payment-pending` 
- `payment-approved` 
- `ready-for-handling` 
- `handling` 
- `invoiced` 
- `canceled`

parameters.name: f_status
parameters.description:
You can filter orders by the following [order status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196) descriptions: 
- `Aguardando+autoriza√ß√£o+para+despachar` 
- `Pagamento+Pendente` 
- `Pagamento+Aprovado` 
- `Pronto+para+o+manuseio` 
- `Preparando+Entrega` 
- `Faturado` 
- `Cancelado`

parameters.name: incompleteOrders
parameters.description: When set as `true`, you retrieve [incomplete orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/understanding-incomplete-orders), when set as `false`, you retrieve orders that are not incomplete.

parameters.name: incompleteOrders
parameters.description: You can use this parameter to filter [incomplete orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/understanding-incomplete-orders) by their situations, whether permanent (`perm`) or temporary (`temp`). When the situation is temporary, the order is still opened and has not being cancelled. To filter the total number of incomplete orders, use the value `all`.

parameters.name: f_paymentNames
parameters.description: You can filter orders by payment type.

parameters.name: f_RnB
parameters.description: You can filter orders by rates and benefits (promotions).

parameters.name: searchField
parameters.description:
You can search orders by using one of the following criterias: 
- SKU ID - `sku_Ids&sku_Ids` 
- Gift List ID - `listId&listId` 
- Transaction ID (TID) - `tid&tid` 
- PCI Connector's Transaction ID (TID) - `pci_tid&pci_tid` 
- Payment ID (PID) - `paymentId&paymentId` 
- Connector's NSU - `nsu&nsu`

schema.default:
- SKU ID: `25` 
- Gift List ID: `11223` 
- Transaction ID (TID): `54546300238810034995829230012` 
- PCI Connector's Transaction ID (TID): `7032909234899834298423209` 
- Payment ID (PID): `2`

post.description:
You should use this endpoint to cancel an order by its order identification number (the `orderId`).

A common scenario is one where the seller has a problem with the order fulfillment and needs to request the order cancellation to the marketplace. To do this, the seller would need to make this request, passing the `orderId` in the URL.

You should expect a response with the date when the notification was received, the orderId, and a receipt protocol code.

Be aware that if the order status is already `Invoiced`, the order can only be canceled if‚Äîbefore using this request‚Äîyou send a return invoice through the [Order Invoice Notification endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/invoice#invoicenotification).

> The `Cancel order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

post.description:
> Timeout settings
>
> This is a synchronous API, which means the application requests data and waits until a value is returned. This behavior can cause timeout errors; to avoid them, we recommend setting the timeout in 20 seconds.

 This request allows [changing an order](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/changing-items-from-a-completed-order--tutorials_190) by:
- Adding items to an order
- Removing items from an order
- Applying discounts to the total value of the order
- Incrementing the total value of the order. 

In those scenarios of order changes, it is possible to insert a [Partial invoice](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/orders--2xkTisx4SXOWXQel8Jg8sa/q9GPspTb9cHlMeAZfdEUe). The total value of the order will be updated after the insertion of the invoice, even when there is a partial invoice scenario. The updated value is settled by VTEX's Payment Gateway. The reimbursement for the shopper is automatic. 

This action can only be done for orders in these status:
- `handling`
- `waiting-for-fulfillment` 

> The `Change order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

post.description:
Entering the [invoice in the order](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/orders--2xkTisx4SXOWXQel8Jg8sa/2WgQrlHTyVo4hLjhUs1LMT) is a required step for its [status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196#order-status-details) to change to Invoiced - a sign that the order has been successfully completed. Remember that once an order is read as invoiced by the system, this status cannot be changed. 

The total value of the order will be updated after the insertion of the invoice, even when there's a [Partial invoice](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/orders--2xkTisx4SXOWXQel8Jg8sa/q9GPspTb9cHlMeAZfdEUe) scenario. The updated value is settled by VTEX's Payment Gateway. The reimbursement for the shopper is automatic. 

We strongly recommend that you always send the object of the invoiced items. With this practice, rounding errors will be avoided. 

When returning items, an input invoice must be sent through this call. For that, the `type` field should be filled in with `input`. 

It is not allowed to use the same `invoiceNumber` in more than one request to the Order Invoice Notification endpoint.

For marketplace integrations: once the order is invoiced, the seller should use this request to send the invoice information to the marketplace. Be aware that this endpoint is also used by the seller to send the order tracking information. This, however, should be done in a separate moment, once the seller has the tracking information.  

> The `Notify invoice` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

> üìò Onboarding guide 
>
> Check the new [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

The Orders Feed v3 is the best way to create order integrations. Below you can find details on the configuration API specification, and to know more see our [Feed v3 guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-feed) and our [order integration guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/erp-integration-set-up-order-integration).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

filter.description: Information on how orders are filtered to show on the feed.

type.description: Determines what orders appear in the feed and how they are filtered. If a feed has the `FromWorkflow` type configuration, it will receive order updates only when order‚Äôs statuses change and orders can be filtered by status, using the `status` field. A feed with the `FromOrders` type configuration gets updates whenever any change is made to an order. in this case, orders can be filtered by any property, according to JSONata expressions set in the `expression` field.

status.description: List of order statuses that should be included in the feed. This should only be used in case `type` is `FromWorkflow`.

items.description: Order status to be filtered in the feed.

expression.description: JSONata query expression that defines what conditions must be met for an order to be included in the feed. This should only be used in case `type` is `FromOrders`.

disableSingleFire.description: Sets a limit to how many times a specific order shows on the feed, after it first meets filtering conditions. Using the `FromOrders` type configuration with JSONata filtering expressions might cause orders to appear more than once on a feed, whenever changes are made to that order. If this field is `false` orders will appear in the feed only once.

queue.description: Information that define the functioning of the queue.

visibilityTimeoutInSeconds.description: Period of time for which an item is not visible in the feed after it has been retrieved with the Get feed items request. Measured in seconds.

MessageRetentionPeriodInSeconds.description: Maximum life span of an order update after it gets to the feed. When a feed item is on the feed for this period of time, it is removed from the feed. Measured in seconds.

quantity.description: Current number of messages in the feed, including messages that may not be visible due to time out after retrieval.

approximateAgeOfOldestMessageInSeconds.description: Aproximate age of the oldest message in the feed, measured in seconds.

post.description:
The Orders Feed v3 is the best way to create order integrations. Below you can find details on the configuration API specification, and to know more see our [Feed v3 guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-feed) and our [order integration guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/erp-integration-set-up-order-integration)

There are two types of filtering that can be used. The `FromWorkflow` type filters orders by status, whereas the `FromOrders` type uses JSONata expressions to filter orders according to any property in the orders JSON document. This enables stores to filter delivered orders and orders in which products have been added or removed, for example. To learn more, access the [JSONata documentation](https://docs.jsonata.org/overview.html) and test filtering JSONata expressions with our [Test JSONata expression](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#post-/api/orders/expressions/jsonata) endpoint.

ClientProfileData.description: Object with information on the client's profile.

id.description: Object ID, the expected value is `clientProfileData`.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

document.description: Document identification code informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: If the customer is a legal entity, here goes the corporate name.

tradeName.description: If the customer is a legal entity, here goes the trade name.

corporateDocument.description: If the customer is a legal entity, here goes the corporate document.

stateInscription.description: If the customer is a legal entity, here goes the state inscription.

corporatePhone.description: If the customer is a legal entity, here goes the corpany's phone number.

isCorporate.description: The value is `true` when the customer is a legal entity and `false` when not.

customerClass.description: Identification of the class the customer belongs to.

RatesAndBenefitsData.title: RatesAndBenefitsData
RatesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on promotions and taxes that apply to the order.

id.description: ID of the rate or benefit.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: Information about order's promotions and taxes identifiers.

id.description: Object ID, the expected value is `shippingData`.

logisticsInfo.description: Array of objects containing item's logistics information.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`, among others.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

postalCode.description: Postal code of the shipping address.

country.description: Three letters ISO code of the country of the shipping address (ISO 3166 ALPHA-3).

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address when it applies.

reference.description: Complement to help locate the shipping address, in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two numbers with geocoordinates, first longitude then latitude.

itemIndex.description: Index of the item starting from 0.

price.description: Shipping price for the item in cents. Does not account for the whole order's shipping price.

listPrice.description: SKU's optional price for a specific trade policy.

deliveryWindow.description: [Scheduled delivery](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/scheduled-delivery--22g3HAVCGLFiU7xugShOBi) window information, if it applies to the item.

shippingEstimate.description: Total shipping estimate time in days. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

shippingEstimateDate.description: Shipping estimate date. It is defined only after the confirmation of the order.

slas.description: Information on Service Level Agreement (SLA), corresponding to [shipping policies](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/shipping-policy--tutorials_140).

shipsTo.description: Three letters ISO code of the country of the shipping address (ISO 3166 ALPHA-3).

deliveryChannels.description: List of delivery channels associated with the trade policy.

id.description: Delivery channel's shipping type, which can be `delivery` or `pickup-in-point`.

stockBalance.description: Stock check for an SKU availability.

deliveryChannel.description: If the delivery channel is `delivery` or `pickup-in-point`.

polygonName.description: Name of the [polygon](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/registering-geolocation/) associated with the shipping policy.

transitTime.description: Duration in business days of the time the carrier takes in transit to fulfill the order. For example, three business days is represented `3bd`.

id.description: ID of the shipping method used in the [shipping policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/shipping-policy--tutorials_140).

shippingEstimate.description: Total shipping estimate time in days. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

deliveryWindow.description: [Scheduled delivery window](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/scheduled-delivery--22g3HAVCGLFiU7xugShOBi) information, if it applies to the item.

price.description: Shipping price for the item in cents. Does not account for the whole order's shipping price.

deliveryChannel.description: If the delivery channel is `delivery` or `pickup-in-point`.

polygonName.description: Name of the [polygon](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/registering-geolocation/) associated with the shipping policy.

lockTTL.description: Logistics [reservation](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-does-reservation-work--tutorials_92) waiting time of the SLA.

transitTime.description: Duration in business days of the time the carrier takes in transit to fulfill the order. For example, three business days is represented `3bd`.

pickupDistance.description: Distance in kilometers between the pickup point and the customer's address. The distance is measured as a straight line.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information about the pickup point.

dockId.description: ID of the [loading dock](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/doca--5DY8xHEjOLYDVL41Urd5qj) related to the delivery or the pickup point.

friendlyName.description: Name of the pickup point displayed at checkout.

isPickupStore.description: If this field is set `true`, it means the type of shipping is pickup, and if set as `false`, it is not.

kitItemDetails.description: Information about [kits](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/what-is-a-kit--5ov5s3eHM4AqAAgqWwoc28), if there are any.

versionId.description: Shipping address version ID of the selected address.

entityId.description: Shipping address entity ID  of the selected address.

addressType.description: Selected adress's shipping type, which can be `pickup`, `residential`, `invoice`, `search`, `inStore`, `commercial` or `giftRegistry`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order in the selected address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment of the selected address.

complement.description: Complement to the selected address if it applies.

postalCode.description: Postal code of the selected address.

country.description: Three letters ISO code of the country of the selected address (ISO 3166 ALPHA-3).

reference.description: Complement to help locate the selected address.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two numbers with the selected address's geocoordinates, first longitude then latitude.

PaymentData.title: PaymentData
PaymentData.description: Object with information about the payment.

giftCards.description: Array with information about Gift Cards.

isActive.description: When this field is set as `true`, the payment is active, and when it is `false`, the payment is inactive.

merchantName.description: Name of the merchant that will receive the payment.

id.description: VTEX payment ID that can be used as unique identifier.

cardHolder.description: Name of the person who owns the card.

cardNumber.description: Numeric sequence of the card used in the transaction.

firstDigits.description: Fist digits of the card used in the transaction.

lastDigits.description: Last digits of the card used in the transaction.

cvv2.description: Card Verification Value (CVV2) is a security code used by payment processors to reduce fraudulent credit and debit card transactions.

expireMonth.description: Expire month of the card used in the transaction (2-digits).

expireYear.description: Expire year of the card used in the transaction (4-digits).

redemptionCode.description: Code for the customer to use the Gift Card.

group.description: Name of the collection the Gift Card belongs to.

tid.description: Provider's unique identifier for the transaction.

dueDate.description: Payment due date, with the format `yyyy-mm-dd`.

Tid.description: Provider's unique identifier for the transaction.

ReturnCode.description: Provider's operation/error code to be logged.

Message.description: Provider's operation/error message to be logged.

giftCardAsDiscount.description: When this field is set as `true`, the Gift Card is a discount over the price, and when set as `false`, it is not a discount.

parentAccountId.description: This field retrieves the main account if the payment was made in a subaccount.

bankIssuedInvoiceIdentificationNumber.description: Numeric sequence that identifies the bank issued invoice.

bankIssuedInvoiceBarCodeNumber.description: Number of the bank issued invoice bar code.

bankIssuedInvoiceBarCodeType.description: Type of the bank issued invoice bar code.

PackageAttachment.title: PackageAttachment
PackageAttachment.description: Package object populated after order invoiced.

Seller.title: Seller
Seller.description: Information about the seller associated with the order.

id.description: Seller ID that identifies the seller.

fulfillmentEndpoint.description: URL of the endpoint for fulfillment of seller's orders.

ChangesAttachment.title: ChangesAttachment
ChangesAttachment.description: Information about changes in the order.

id.description: Object ID, the expect value is `changeAttachment`.

reason.description: Text explaining why there was a change in the order. This information may be shown to the customer in the UI or transactional emails.

itemsAdded.description: List of items added to the order.

itemsRemoved.description: List of items removed from the order.

id.description: SKU ID of the item removed from the order.

name.description: Name of the item removed from the order.

quantity.description: Quantity of items removed from the order.

price.description: Total amount of items removed from the order.

unitMultiplier.description: Unit multiplier of the item removed from the order.

Receipt.title: Receipt
Receipt.description: Information about the receipt for changed orders.

date.description: Date when the receipt was created.

StorePreferencesData.title: StorePreferencesData
StorePreferencesData.description: Object with data from the store's configuration - stored in VTEX's License Manager.

countryCode.description: Three letters ISO code of the country (ISO 3166 ALPHA-3).

currencyCode.description: Currency code in ISO 4217. For example, `BRL`.

currencyLocale.description: Currency Locale Code in LCID in decimal.

timeZone.description: Time zone from where the order was made.

CurrencyDecimalSeparator.description: Defines what currency decimal separator will be applied.

CurrencyGroupSeparator.description: Defines what currency group separator will be applied.

CurrencyGroupSize.description: Defines how many characters will be grouped.

StartsWithCurrencySymbol.description: Defines if all prices will be initiated with the currency symbol (`true`) or not (`false`).

Marketplace.title: Marketplace
Marketplace.description: Details about the marketplace related to the order.

requestId.description: Request identification of the change. Only the first change made with each `requestId` will be effective on a given order. Use different IDs for different changes to the same order.

price.description: Price of the item in cents.

quantity.description: Amount of items to be removed.

quantity.description: Amount of items to be added.

invoiceValue.description: Total amount being invoiced in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

invoiceUrl.description: URL of the invoice. Can be used to send the URL of an XML file, for example, which is useful for some integrations.

embeddedInvoice.description: XML text of the invoice, not the URL. This field is very important for external marketplace integrations such as Mercado Libre.

group.description:
It represents the payment method. For each method, it can have the following values: 

- **Credit card:** `creditCard` 

- **Debid card:** `debitCard`

- **Bank invoice:** `bankInvoice`

- **Promissory:** `promissory` 

- **Gift card:** `giftCard` 

- **Pix:** `instantPayment`

handles.description: List of item handles to commit

FeedFilter.title: Filter
FeedFilter.description: Object with type and status that will filter feed orders.

type.description:
Determines what orders appear in the feed and how they are filtered. There are two possible values:

-`FromWorkflow`: the feed will receive order updates only when order‚Äôs statuses change and orders can be filtered by status, using the `status` field described below.

-`FromOrders`: the feed gets updates whenever any change is made to an order. in this case, orders can be filtered by any property, according to JSONata expressions passed in the `expression` field described below.

status.description:
List of order statuses that should be included in the feed. This should only be used in case `type` is set to `FromWorkflow`. The status event will be removed, if it can't deliver a message more than 100 times, 4 days progressively. 

**Status available to filter** 

- order-created 

- on-order-completed 

- on-order-completed-ffm 

- payment-pending 

- waiting-for-order-authorization 

- approve-payment 

- payment-approved 

- request-cancel 

- waiting-for-seller-decision 

- waiting-ffmt-authorization 

- waiting-for-authorization 

- waiting-for-manual-authorization 

- authorize-fulfillment 

- order-create-error 

- order-creation-error 

- window-to-cancel 

- window-to-change-seller 

- waiting-for-mkt-authorization 

- waiting-seller-handling 

- ready-for-handling 

- start-handling 

- handling 

- invoice-after-cancellation-deny 

- order-accepted 

- invoice 

- invoiced 

- replaced 

- cancellation-requested

expression.description: JSONata query expression that defines what conditions must be met for an order to be included in the feed. This should only be used in case `type` is set to `FromOrders`.

disableSingleFire.description: Sets a limit to how many times a specific order shows on the feed, after it first meets filtering conditions. Using the `FromOrders` type configuration with JSONata filtering expressions might cause orders to appear more than once on a feed, whenever changes are made to that order. If this field is `false` orders will appear in the feed only once.

type.description:
Determines what orders appear in the hook and how they are filtered. As shown in the examples above, there are two ways:

 - `FromWorkflow`: the hook will receive order updates only when there is a change or update in the [order status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196). You must send at least one value for the `status` field to determine by which status the orders will be filtered.

 - `FromOrders`: the hook will receive order updates when there is a change in the order. In this case, orders can be filtered by any property, according to JSONata expressions passed in the `expression` field. You must send the request with values for the `expression` and `disableSingleFire` fields.

status.description: List of order statuses that should be included in the hook. This should only be used in case `type` is `FromWorkflow`.

expression.description: JSONata query expression that defines what conditions must be met for an order to be included in the hook. This should only be used in case `type` is `FromOrders`.

disableSingleFire.description: Sets a limit to how many times a specific order shows on the hook, after it first meets filtering conditions. Using the `FromOrders` type configuration with JSONata filtering expressions might cause orders to appear more than once on a feed, whenever changes are made to that order. If this field is `false` orders will appear in the hook only once. Send this field if you want to filter `FromOrders`.

MessageRetentionPeriodInSeconds.description: Maximum life span of an order update in the feed. When a feed item is on the feed for this period of time, it is removed from the feed. Measured in seconds.

orderId.description: Order ID is a unique code that identifies an order.

statusDescription.description: Status description which is displayed on the Admin panel. This field is deprecated and may not return any value.

sequence.description: Six-digit string that follows the order ID. For example, in order `1268540501456-01 (501456)`, the sequence is `501456`.

salesChannel.description: Sales channel (or [trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) ID related to the order.

affiliateId.description: Corresponds to the three-digits [affiliate](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-affiliates--tutorials_187) identification code of the seller responsible for the order.

workflowInErrorState.description: If there is a work flow error (`true`) or not (`false`).

workflowInRetry.description: If the order is in a work flow retry (`true`) or not (`false`).

ShippingEstimatedDateMax.description: The most extended shipping estimation possible.

ShippingEstimatedDateMin.description: The least extended shipping estimation possible.

orderIsComplete.description: If it is a completed order (`true`) or not (`false`). For more information, see [Order flow and status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196).

callCenterOperatorName.description: Call center operator responsible for the order.

currencyCode.description: Currency code in ISO 4217. For example, `BRL`.

id.description: Item's SKU ID, which is a unique numerical identifier.

productId.description: ID of the Product associated with the item.

orderId.description: Order ID is a unique code that identifies an order.

sequence.description: Sequence is a six-digit string that follows the order ID. For example, in order `1268540501456-01 (501456)`, the sequence is `501456`.

sellerOrderId.description: ID of the seller related to the order. It can be a VTEX seller or an external seller.

affiliateId.description: Corresponds to the three-digit [affiliate](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-affiliates--tutorials_187) identification code of the seller responsible for the order.

salesChannel.description: Sales channel (or [trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) ID related to the order.

statusDescription.description: `Deprecated`. Status description which is displayed on the Admin panel. This field is obsolete and may not return any value.

totals.description: List with details about orders' totals.

giftRegistryData.description: Information about gift list, when it applies.

marketingData.description: Information about promotions and marketing. For example, coupon tracking information and internal or external UTMs.

id.description: Object ID which expected value is `marketingData`.

utmSource.description: Value of the `utm_source` parameter of the URL that led to the request.

utmMedium.description: Value of the `utm_medium` parameter of the URL that led to the request.

utmCampaign.description: Value of the `utm_campaign` parameter of the URL that led to the request.

marketingTags.description: Marketing tags information. This field can be used to register campaign data or informative tags regarding promotions.

sellers.description: List of all sellers associated with the order.

callCenterOperatorData.description: Call center operator responsible for the order.

followUpEmail.description: Email of the store's employee responsible for managing the order.

hostname.description: Account Hostname registered in License Manager.

invoiceData.description: Information pertinent to the order's invoice.

roundingError.description: Rounding error total amount, if it applies. For example, in orders with a discount over non-integer multiplier items, the rounding price is performed per item, not after the sum of all items. That can cause a difference in the total discount amount, which is informed in this field.

isCompleted.description: When set as `true`, the order's payment has been settled, and when set as `false`, it has not been settled yet.

customData.description: Custom information in the order. This field is useful for storing data not included in other fields, for example, a message for a gift or a name to be printed in a shirt.

allowCancellation.description: When set as `true`, the order can be canceled, and when set as `false`, it is no longer possible to cancel the order.

allowEdition.description: When set as `true`, the order can be edited, and when set as `false`, it is no longer possible to edit the order.

isCheckedIn.description: This field is set `true` when the order was made via inStore and `false` when it was not.

itemMetadata.description: Metadata information about the order's items.

Id.description: Item's SKU ID, which is a unique numerical identifier.

Seller.description: Seller ID that identifies the seller the item belongs to.

Name.description: Name of the item as displayed to customers in the storefront.

SkuName.description: Name of the SKU corresponding to the item.

ProductId.description: ID of the Product associated with the item.

AssemblyOptions.description: Displays information about [assembly options](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/assembly-options--5x5FhNr4f5RUGDEGWzV1nH) related to the item, if there are any.

Id.description: ID of the attachment related to the order.

Name.description: Name of the attachment related to the order.

Required.description: If this field is set as `true`, when the customer purchases the item sending the attachment is required, and when set as `false`, sending the attachment is optional.

SubscriptionGroupId.description: ID of the subscription's group. If this field returns `null` and the `executionCount` is `0`, the order is the first one with subscriptions.

Subscriptions.description: List with subscriptions and their details.

ExecutionCount.description: Position of the order in the subscription cycle. The first order will have the value `0`, the second will have the value `1`, and so on.

PriceAtSubscriptionDate.description: Price of the order when the customer signed up for subscriptions. Subscriptions created from Admin UI or APIs do not have an original order, so the field returns `0.0`. This field was valid only for Subscriptions v2 and is deprecated in Subscriptions v3.

ItemIndex.description: Each item in the subscriptions' order is identified by an index. The position starts in`0`, followed by `1`, `2`, and so on.

Plan.description: Information about the subscription's validility and frequency.

periodicity.description: Defines the subscriptions recurrence period. The possible values are `DAILY`,`WEEKLY`, `MONTHLY` and `YEARLY`.

interval.description: Number of the time interval configured between subscription orders, which depends on the periodicity. For a `DAILY` periodicity, the field's value will correspond to days, for `MONTHLY` to months, and so on.

validity.description: Information about the period during which the subscription will be valid.

begin.description: Subscriptions' beginning date with the format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`.

end.description: Subscriptions' ending date with the format `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`.

areTaxesDesignatedByMarketplace.description: If the taxes were designated by the marketplace (`true`), or not (`false`).

sku.description: Alphanumeric sequence that identifies an SKU.

isPercentual.description: If the tax is a percentage (`true`) or note (`false`).

rawValue.description: The amount that corresponds to the tax.

checkedInPickupPointId.description: If the field `isCheckedIn` is set as `true`, the `checkedInPickupPointId` will retrieve the ID of the physical store where the order was made.

cancellationData.description: Information about order cancellation, when it applies.

RequestedByUser.description: If the order cancellation was requested by the costumer (`true`) or not (`false`).

RequestedBySystem.description: If the order cancellation was made by the system (`true`) or not (`false`). This type of order cancellation happens in [incomplete orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-incomplete-orders-work--tutorials_294), for example.

RequestedBySellerNotification.description: If the order cancellation was requested by the seller (`true`) or not (`false`).

RequestedByPaymentNotification.description: If the order cancellation was requested by the payment gateway (`true`) or not (`false`).

Reason.description: The reason why the order was cancelled.

CancellationDate.description: The date when the order was cancelled.

locale.description: Customer's prefered language while accessing the store.

optinNewsLetter.description: When set as `true`, this field indicates customers opted to receive the newsletters, and when set as `false`, it means they did not.

cancellationData.Reason: Item was too big in the client.

Document.description: JSON document to be evaluated by the expression.

reason.name: reason
reason.description: Reason for requesting unmasked data. Relevant only for PII platform version.
